title: Storm-Anchor of Names
description: The Saltglass Expanse hisses underfoot, a sea frozen mid-storm where dunes flash green-blue like scales on a sleeping wyrm. Veyla Prism ties her scarf against the glare and leads Rogan by the shadow of fulgurite spires that hum when a name is spoken too sharply. The storm-anchor—an old monolith forged by lightning and strange hands—shivers when the cullet thread is held near it, a tuning fork answered by a cathedral bell. Syndicate escorts skulk on mirrored ridges, and Pera Thass—notorious fixer with a smile like a polished shard—calls wind with practiced words. The anchor will bring a storm to the mouth of the Resonant Gate if the name ‘Marrowhold’ is spoken into it thrice in the right key, and the city will be tested by a fire dressed as rain. Rogan must sever the link, seize evidence, and leave before a glass wyrm remembers the last dream of a titan and surfaces to eat the instruments of men.
objectives: Reach the fulgurite monolith with Veyla Prism and map the hum using the cullet thread.
Eavesdrop on Pera Thass and Syndicate technicians to learn the trigger rite.
Prevent the speaking of Marrowhold’s name in the correct key or sabotage the anchor’s resonance.
Survive a glass wyrm’s breach long enough to complete the sabotage.
Collect a fulgurite shard that carries the Gate’s false note as physical proof.

intro.speaker: Veyla Prism
intro.line: Keep your steps light and your voice lighter. The dunes love a man who thinks he is alone, and they’ll open for him like a friend. The anchor is just ahead, humming to itself like a throat clearing before a lie.

intro.speaker: Pera Thass
intro.line: We speak the city’s name gently, as if waking a child, and the sky will answer as if it loves us. It’s only weather, boys, and weather always belongs to the men who can afford to be wrong.

intro.speaker: Rogan Kettlebone
intro.line: I’ve seen weather rip roofs off homes and leave the baby’s cradle untouched. It doesn’t love anyone; it only listens when you tempt it. Step away from that monolith, Pera, before it gives you what you asked for and more than you can hold.

mid.speaker: Pera Thass
mid.line: Rogan Kettlebone, the stray watchdog who thinks a growl makes him free. I don’t need to finish the rite to ruin you. But I could, and then I’d be the only one with a dry shirt when the city begs for towels.

mid.speaker: Veyla Prism
mid.line: She’s off-key by a breath. If you can keep her talking, I can set a mirror at the wrong angle and break the chord. Or you can cut the filament and pray the wyrm prefers music to meat today.

mid.speaker: Rogan Kettlebone
mid.line: I’ll take my chances with teeth that don’t sue in court. Keep your mirror brave, Veyla. I’ll make a noise ugly enough to make the sky blush.

completion.speaker: Glass Wyrm (the breach)
completion.line: The dune puckers and opens like an eye waking, then closes again on a smell of ozone and old rain. The song breaks. The wyrm decides hunger is a problem for a different day.

completion.speaker: Veyla Prism
completion.line: It’s done. The anchor is deaf where it should be eager. Take this shard; it hums with the false note the way a guilty man hums in a quiet room. Keep it tight against your oaths.

completion.speaker: Rogan Kettlebone
completion.line: Tell Zexi to watch the kites for a storm looking for its name and finding none. I’ll bring this to someone who can scrape the last of the lie off the Gate’s strings.

rewards.description: Fulgurite Shard tuned to the false note (admits resonance evidence).
Soured relations with the Saltglass Syndicate (they take notice).
Veyla Prism’s ongoing assistance in glass terrains.
